Getting Started with the Pointwise Viewer

Pointwise Viewer can be used to view virtually any mesh file in 3-D. It will display the mesh in a variety of styles, and compute any of dozens of mesh quality metrics.

To help you get started using the viewer, please watch this short Tutorial Tuesday Video. We have included some files you can download to open and view with the Pointwise Viewer. We also emailed you a list of other helpful videos.

Built-in mesh importers are available for two dozen formats, including CGNS, FUN3D, OpenFOAM, SU2, UGRID, and more. If your mesh format isn't available, an SDK is available for you to write your own mesh importer that appears in the GUI automatically at startup. The meshes can be displayed however best suits your needs: wireframe, hidden line, solid fill, or shaded. Tools are available for measuring distances. And you can assess your mesh's quality by computing and displaying a wide variety of metrics, including Jacobian, skewness, size ratios, and more. Pointwise Viewer also provides geometry model viewing capability for models in ACIS, CATIA, Creo, IGES, STEP, SolidWorks, STL, and other formats.
